intro: Leucheria hahnii, commonly known as the Hahn's leucheria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
